<@UMZFZHVUJ> fwiw we are sticking with hubl 99% of the time unless an entire project requires serious state management. In that case react makes sense.

Also if we put a react dev in charge of a project then it’ll also make sense (resource-wise).

But from my assessment it just seems over-engineered most of the time. HS React modules will probably only replace 2 standard modules in our company codebase.

Currently we’re making a podcast microsite (kinda like a spotify or yt music clone) and react is the perfect tool for the job… but most b2b sites don’t need it imo

<@U3T21PDBK> Thanks for sharing your approach!
I relate to it. As you said, if there is no serious state management, using react seems to be over-engineering.
Just wanted to check other perspectives and whether I might miss something here.

Hi there. This seems like it would be obvious but apparently not. Using DnD editor to build landing pages and would like to basically `valign="top"` the rich text module within the left column. Doesn't seem like that is an option with the default tools - any ideas for how to make it so the text is at the top of the column rather than in the middle?
